abstract: Bank of America won a bid to continue blocking regulators from gaining access to more than $1 billion in cash and loans held by the bankrupt Colonial BancGroup. Late Friday, a federal judge in Miami extended an injunction barring the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and Colonial officials from disposing of the defunct bank’s assets over which Bank of America has a claim. Colonial was closed by regulators and taken over by the BB&T Corporation last month. Bank of America sued Colonial to block its use of the $1 billion, saying that the bank was holding the assets in trust for one of Bank of America’s units.

lead_paragraph: Bank of America won a bid to continue blocking regulators from gaining access to more than $1 billion in cash and loans held by the bankrupt Colonial BancGroup. Late Friday, a federal judge in Miami extended an injunction barring the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and Colonial officials from disposing of the defunct bank’s assets over which Bank of America has a claim. Colonial was closed by regulators and taken over by the BB&T Corporation last month. Bank of America sued Colonial to block its use of the $1 billion, saying that the bank was holding the assets in trust for one of Bank of America’s units.

headline.main: Bid to Block Access to Colonial’s Assets Is Granted
headline.print_headline: Bid To Block Access To Colonial’s Assets Is Granted

abstract: Companies are learning to combine the new approaches of design thinking with the time-tested analyses of Six Sigma.
snippet: Companies are learning to combine the new approaches of design thinking with the time-tested analyses of Six Sigma.
lead_paragraph: FOR decades, companies from Cisco Systems to Staples to Bank of America have worked to embed the basic techniques of Six Sigma, the business approach that relies on measurement and analysis to make operations as efficient as possible.

headline.main: Welcoming the New, Improving the Old
headline.print_headline: Welcoming The New, Improving The Old
